task.instruction: You are logged in as user with email emi.walker@tech.org. Check if the page with ID 18 is titled "Deployment Guide 101" with space ID 1, and if it is not, you wish to change it. You also want to create a new page entitled "Deployment Guide 102", whose parent is the one you updated. The content should, however, be a link "click to view page", and the content format should be same as the template in the archived space named "Meeting Notes". The space should similar to your original page 18, and the template should be the one identified in the above stated space. Finally, you wish to add the label named label-95 to your newly created page, and label-97 to your updated page.

# Deployment Guide

Deployment guide for production environments.

## Prerequisites

This section covers prerequisites related information and guidelines. Follow the procedures outlined here to ensure proper prerequisites implementation.

## Installation

This section covers installation related information and guidelines. Follow the procedures outlined here to ensure proper installation implementation.

## Configuration

This section covers configuration related information and guidelines. Follow the procedures outlined here to ensure proper configuration implementation.

## Verification

This section covers verification related information and guidelines. Follow the procedures outlined here to ensure proper verification implementation.

## Rollback

This section covers rollback related information and guidelines. Follow the procedures outlined here to ensure proper rollback implementation.

## Additional Resources

- Related documentation links
- Support contact information
- Training materials
output.title: Deployment Guide

output.content:
API Documentation: [API Name]

Overview

The [API Name] provides [brief description of API purpose and capabilities]. This RESTful API enables [main use cases] with [key benefits].

Base URL

https://api.example.com/v1

API Version

Current Version: v1.0
Last Updated: [Date]

Authentication

API Key Authentication

Include your API key in the request header:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Getting Your API Key

  1. Log into your account dashboard
  2. Navigate to API Settings
  3. Generate a new API key
  4. Store it securely (it won"t be shown again)

Rate Limiting

  • Rate Limit: 1000 requests per hour
  • Burst Limit: 50 requests per minute
  • Headers: X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset

Endpoints

Users

GET /users

Retrieve a list of users

ParameterTypeRequiredDescription
pageintegerNoPage number (default: 1)
limitintegerNoItems per page (default: 20, max: 100)
searchstringNoSearch term for filtering

Example Request:

GET /users?page=1&limit=10&search=john
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Example Response:

{
  "users": [
    {
      "id": 123,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
      "status": "active"
    }
  ],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 10,
    "total": 1,
    "total_pages": 1
  }
}

GET /users/{id}

Retrieve a specific user by ID

ParameterTypeRequiredDescription
idintegerYesUser ID

Example Request:

GET /users/123
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

POST /users

Create a new user

Request Body:

{
  "name": "Jane Smith",
  "email": "jane@example.com",
  "role": "user"
}

PUT /users/{id}

Update an existing user

DELETE /users/{id}

Delete a user

Projects

GET /projects

Retrieve a list of projects

POST /projects

Create a new project

Error Handling

HTTP Status Codes

CodeDescriptionCommon Causes
200OKRequest successful
201CreatedResource created successfully
400Bad RequestInvalid request format or parameters
401UnauthorizedMissing or invalid API key
403ForbiddenInsufficient permissions
404Not FoundResource doesn"t exist
429Too Many RequestsRate limit exceeded
500Internal Server ErrorServer-side error

Error Response Format

{
  "error": {
    "code": "INVALID_REQUEST",
    "message": "The request is missing required parameter "name"",
    "details": {
      "field": "name",
      "reason": "required"
    }
  }
}

SDKs and Libraries

Official SDKs

  • JavaScript/Node.js: npm install api-client
  • Python: pip install api-client
  • PHP: composer require api/client
  • Ruby: gem install api_client

Example Usage (JavaScript)

const ApiClient = require("api-client");
const client = new ApiClient("YOUR_API_KEY");

// Get users
const users = await client.users.list({ page: 1, limit: 10 });

// Create a user
const newUser = await client.users.create({
  name: "John Doe",
  email: "john@example.com"
});

Webhooks

Available Events

  • user.created: Triggered when a new user is created
  • user.updated: Triggered when a user is modified
  • project.completed: Triggered when a project is completed

Webhook Configuration

  1. Navigate to Webhook Settings in your dashboard
  2. Add your endpoint URL
  3. Select events to subscribe to
  4. Save and test the webhook

Testing

Sandbox Environment

Base URL: https://api-sandbox.example.com/v1

Use sandbox API keys for testing (prefix: sk_test_)

Postman Collection

Download Postman Collection

Support

  • Documentation: [docs_url]
  • Developer Forum: [forum_url]
  • Email Support: api-support@example.com
  • Status Page: [status_url]

Changelog

v1.0 (2024-07-01)

  • Initial API release
  • Basic CRUD operations for users and projects
  • API key authentication
output.description: API documentation template covering endpoints, authentication, request/response formats, error handling, and integration examples.
output.name: API Documentation Template 24
